spans.content: Location Reasoning. We compare the results of our QR-
CLIP with other methods for location reasoning in Tab.1.
.All the results clearly show that our method
(1) Compared with ResNet-50 (He et al.,2016) and Swin-
T (Liu et al., 2021), vanilla CLIP achieves
absolute improvement in location prediction accuracy (ID:
1,2,3). It indicates that compared with the vision model
only trained on ImageNet (Deng et al., 2009), CLIP al-
ready possesses some knowledge for reasoning.Meanwhile,
our QR-CLIP achieves a more significant advantage with
absolute improvements in terms of ac-
curacy (ID: 1,2,6). These results show that traditional image
classification methods cannot accomplish inference of the
abstract information behind the images. While the CLIP
model trained on large-scale internet data have the ability
to identify locations based on image data,and QR-CLIP
{ \mathrm { C L I P } } { + } { \mathrm { S e g } }
Other evaluation metrics also improved. The results show
that QR-CLIP can effectively utilize open-world knowledge
to establish a closer connection between image and location
find that the improvement in Example-F1 is not as obvious.
We argue that this is because the mechanism of Example-F1:
take the image of Fig.1 as an example-the picture show
many Arabia elements (turbanand Arabic). Itisnot difficult
for many models to recognize that this image was captured
in the Middle East and to predict its hierarchical label as
discrepancy in other metrics may be more noticeable.
Time Reasoning. Tab.1 also presents the performance of
our method and existing techniques for time reasoning. The
; compared to the CLIP model, the two metrics have
{ \mathrm { C L I P } } { + } { \mathrm { S e g } }
also based on CLIP fine-tuning,our method obtains
improvement in the accuracy of prediction time,
respectively. Compared with traditional image classification
methods, QR-CLIP has achieved absolute advantages in all
metrics (ID:7,8,12). In addition, due to the lack of time-
related information in the image,the prediction accuracy of
fine-tuning CLIP methods for image time can only reach

QR-CLIP: Introducing Explicit Open-World Knowledge for Location and Time Reasoning
Location Reasoning. We compare the results of our QR-
CLIP with other methods for location reasoning in Tab.1.
.All the results clearly show that our method
(1) Compared with ResNet-50 (He et al.,2016) and Swin-
T (Liu et al., 2021), vanilla CLIP achieves
absolute improvement in location prediction accuracy (ID:
1,2,3). It indicates that compared with the vision model
only trained on ImageNet (Deng et al., 2009), CLIP al-
ready possesses some knowledge for reasoning.Meanwhile,
our QR-CLIP achieves a more significant advantage with
absolute improvements in terms of ac-
curacy (ID: 1,2,6). These results show that traditional image
classification methods cannot accomplish inference of the
abstract information behind the images. While the CLIP
model trained on large-scale internet data have the ability
to identify locations based on image data,and QR-CLIP
{ \mathrm { C L I P } } { + } { \mathrm { S e g } }
Other evaluation metrics also improved. The results show
that QR-CLIP can effectively utilize open-world knowledge
to establish a closer connection between image and location
find that the improvement in Example-F1 is not as obvious.
We argue that this is because the mechanism of Example-F1:
take the image of Fig.1 as an example-the picture show
many Arabia elements (turbanand Arabic). Itisnot difficult
for many models to recognize that this image was captured
in the Middle East and to predict its hierarchical label as
discrepancy in other metrics may be more noticeable.

our method and existing techniques for time reasoning. The
; compared to the CLIP model, the two metrics have

metrics (ID:7,8,12). In addition, due to the lack of time-
related information in the image,the prediction accuracy of
